patient_information: Age: 46 years Sex: female Height: 158 cm Weight: 65 kg Bmi: 26 kg/m² Vaccinations: unknown Allergies: unknown
chief_complaint: Duration: 2 months Symptoms: ["recurrent cutaneous and subcutaneous abscesses", "progressive lymphadenopathy", "weight loss"]
history_of_present_illness: Timeline: 6 to 8 weeks after returning from northern Thailand Key symptoms: ["high fever", "dry cough", "fatigue"] Severity pattern: acute febrile illness
exposure_and_epidemiology: Travel history: recent travel to northern Thailand one month prior Vector exposures: mosquito exposure implied by the endemic setting Animal exposures: no reported animal exposures Water food risks: no reported water or food risks Contacts: no sick contacts reported Season outbreak context: endemic area for histoplasmosis
vitals: Temperature: afebrile Blood pressure: 130/80 mmHg Pulse rate: 80 bpm Respiratory rate: not reported Oxygen saturation: not reported
physical_exam: Findings: ["enlarged, tender cervical, nuchal, inguinal and axillary lymph nodes", "massive, tender swelling of the upper eyelids", "disseminated fluctuant cutaneous and subcutaneous abscesses with surrounding erythema", "painful swelling of the left elbow"]
labs_and_diagnostics: Cbc: {"WCC": "30.8 × 10^9/L", "Hemoglobin": "8.2 g/dL", "MCV": "88 fl", "Platelets": "592 × 10^9/L"} Inflammatory markers: {"CRP": "267 mg/L", "ESR": ">110 mm/h"}
differential_diagnosis: Considered: ["histoplasmosis", "melioidosis", "bacterial infections (Burkholderia pseudomallei, Brucella species, Francisella tularensis)", "mycobacterial infections"] Justification: ["elevated systemic markers of inflammation", "disseminated abscesses with surrounding erythema", "endemic setting for histoplasmosis", "clinical symptoms and laboratory findings consistent with disseminated infection"]
management_and_clinical_course: Treatment: ["liposomal amphotericin B (3 mg/kg per day, total dose 3 g)", "itraconazole maintenance therapy for an additional 6 months"] Response: clinical improvement with full recovery by day 6 Complications: generalized seizure Outcome: fair general condition on follow-up
final_diagnosis: Disease name short: Histoplasmosis Confirmation method: ["positive histoplasma serology", "PCR of fungal cells in lymph node biopsy"] Evidence: ["disseminated abscesses with surrounding erythema", "endemic setting for histoplasmosis", "clinical symptoms and laboratory findings consistent with disseminated infection"]
